result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandy Rachel Armendarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandy Rachel Armendarez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandy Rachel Armendarez was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Costs shall be collected by the Department of Correction as a condition of Extended Supervision and/or Probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
3:39 PM 
Defendant Brandy Rachel Armendarez in court.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Brandy Rachel Armendarez.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Sauder Informs the court this matter is resolved and files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the court.
Defendant enters plea of "NO CONTEST" - Counts 2.
Court questions defendant re: her plea and waiver of rights.
Parties stipulate to a factual basis.
Court questions attorney Sauder re: her clients plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY". 

State moves to dismiss Count 1.
So ordered.

State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney Sauder joins in the motion.

Court Orders: Sentence Withheld Probation for a Period of 2 Years - Concurrent
-Costs
And Invoice To Pay Attorney Fees

2:38 PM 
Defendant Brandy Rachel Armendarez in court.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Brandy Rachel Armendarez. 
Attorney Sauder informs the court discovery is completed and an offer has been made.
Continue for plea/sentencing
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
